from wikipedia the free encyclopedia jump to navigation search lists of solar eclipses geometry of a total solar eclipse not to scale centuries bc 20th 19th 18th 17th 16th 15th 14th 13th 12th 11th 10th 9th 8th 7th 6th 5th 4th 3rd 2nd 1st ad 1st 2nd 3rd 4th 5th 6th 7th 8th 9th 10th 11th 12th 13th 14th 15th 16th 17th 18th 19th 20th 21st 22nd 23rd 24th 25th 26th 27th 28th 29th 30th eclipses seen from australia china philippines russia ukraine see also lists of lunar eclipses map all coordinates using openstreetmap google maps download coordinates as kml gpx this is a list of solar eclipses in the 13th century bc during the period 1300 to 1201 bc there were 250 solar eclipses of which 93 were partial 86 were annular 64 were total and 7 were hybrids the greatest number of eclipses in one year was four occurring in 16 different years 1300 bc 1289 bc 1285 bc 1282 bc 1278 bc 1271 bc 1260 bc 1253 bc 1249 bc 1242 bc 1231 bc 1224 bc 1220 bc 1213 bc 1210 bc and 1202 bc one month december 1210 bc had two eclipses date time of greatest eclipse saros cycle type magnitude central duration location path width geographical area ref s 05 43 56 8 partial 0.1893 16 58 50 46 partial 0.5164 14
